newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH SUPPORT FOR NATO MEMBERSHIP RISES - POLL.
newsitem.headline: CZECH SUPPORT FOR NATO MEMBERSHIP RISES - POLL.

text.p: The number of Czechs supporting their country's entry into the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) rose by three points month-on-month in May to 45 percent, a survey released on Friday said.

The poll conducted by the state-run Institute For Public Opinion Research (IVVM) showed that the numbers opposed to membership also widened, by two points to 34, while 21 percent said they were undecided, after 26 percent in April.
The survey of 1,001 Czechs, taken in the first week of May, said that the percentage of NATO entry supporters rose by seven percentage points over the past six months.

The Czech Republic, along with Hungary and Poland, is seen likely to be among the first post-communist countries to be invited at the Madrid NATO summit scheduled for July to start negotiations on membership in the alliance.
The Czech centre-right coalition government does not plan a referendum on NATO entry but the opposition Social Democrats, who also support joining the alliance, have called for one.
